questions.question: Which literature exam paper will you find the A Christmas Carol question on?

choices.answer: Paper 1
Paper 2

questions.question: How many questions are you expected to answer on 'A Christmas Carol'?

choices.answer: One - an essay about an extract from the book only
One - a question about the whole of the novel only
One - The whole novel and an extract in one question
Two - one about an extract, one about the whole novel

questions.question: What is meant by "tracking through the text"?

choices.answer: Starting at the beginning and working through in order
Using lots of quotations from different parts of the text

questions.question: How can you show the examiner you know the text well?

choices.answer: Give an example from the beginning, middle and end of the novel
Writing about all of the themes and characters
Giving a really detailed explanation of the context
Explaining the whole of the story in your introduction

questions.question: What will a BAD essay do?

choices.answer: Not focus totally on the extract
Keep quotations short (max 6 words)
Explain the whole of the story in the introduction
Refer to the novel with examples OR quotes, but not both
Explain how the context supports our understanding
Include context that is pointless and irrelevant
Seamlessly integrate contextual knowledge into analysis

questions.question: What does it mean to "answer the question in a focus and sustained way"?

choices.answer: Link back to the question consistently
Zoom in on several quotations
Identify and analyse lots of techniques
Explain the whole of the story at the start of your essay.

questions.question: What does writing about "implicit meanings" mean?

choices.answer: Zooming in on key words in a quotation
Writing about the character's thoughts and feelings
Explaining alternative meanings of a quotation
'Digging deep' and finding meanings that aren't immediately obvious

questions.question: Which of these should you NOT do?

choices.answer: Plan before you start writing
Focus entirely on the extract OR the whole novel
Make sure you cover the beginning, middle and end
Keep quotations short - max 6 words

questions.question: What does writing about the writer's intentions mean?

choices.answer: What the author wanted us to understand or feel
Making sure we can picture the characters really well in our heads
Including lots of techniques
Including lots of themes
